subject: Philosophy
title: Correlation vs Causation
description: A quick win: understand Correlation vs Causation.

hook.text: Ice cream sales and drowning deaths both rise in summer. Does ice cream cause drowning?

buildup.text: Correlation means two things happen together. Causation means one actually produces the other.

discovery.text: A hidden third variable â€” hot weather â€” causes both. Without looking deeper, you'll draw the wrong conclusion.

twist.text: Headlines constantly confuse the two. 'Study finds X linked to Y' almost never means X causes Y.

climax.text: Proving causation requires controlled experiments, not just patterns. Correlation is the starting point, not the answer.

quiz.question: Why doesn't correlation prove causation?
options: A hidden third variable may cause both correlated events
